sections.title: 1. Festivals Overview
paragraphs: Rio’s festival calendar is global in scale, featuring samba, film, and beachfront celebrations.

sections.title: 5. Festival Types & Categories
paragraphs: Music, samba, film, and Afro-Brazilian traditions define the calendar.

sections.title: 6. Religious & Faith-Based Festivals
paragraphs: Festa de São Jorge and Iemanjá celebrations are significant.

sections.title: 7. Music & Dance Festivals
paragraphs: Rock in Rio and samba events headline the year.

sections.title: 8. Folk & Traditional Celebrations
paragraphs: June festivals and samba heritage are central to identity.

sections.title: 9. Food & Gastronomy Festivals
paragraphs: Food festivals highlight Rio’s diverse cuisine.

sections.title: 10. Carnival & Pre-Carnival Events
paragraphs: Carnaval do Rio is the most iconic event in Brazil.

sections.title: 11. Indigenous & Afro-Brazilian Festivals
paragraphs: Afro-Rio celebrations are central to cultural identity.

sections.title: 12. State & Municipal Holidays
paragraphs: Public holidays include large-scale civic events.

sections.title: 13. Festival History & Origins
paragraphs: Rio’s festivals reflect colonial history and samba culture.

sections.title: 14. Cultural Significance & Symbolism
paragraphs: Events symbolize global cultural influence and Brazilian identity.

sections.title: 15. Cost & Accessibility
paragraphs: Many events are free; samba parade tickets can be premium.

sections.title: 16. Where Festivals Take Place
paragraphs: Main hubs include Sambódromo, Copacabana, and downtown.

sections.title: 17. Best Time to Visit for Festivals
paragraphs: February for Carnaval and December for New Year.

sections.title: 18. Local Customs & Etiquette
paragraphs: Respect samba culture and follow safety guidance in crowds.

sections.title: 19. Safety & Crowd Tips
paragraphs: Stay aware of surroundings and keep valuables secure.

sections.title: 20. Family-Friendly vs Adult-Oriented Festivals
paragraphs: Daytime events are family-friendly; nightlife is adult-oriented.

sections.title: 21. Festival Food, Drinks & Traditions
paragraphs: Try street snacks and regional sweets during festivals.

sections.title: 23. Fun Facts About Local Festivals
paragraphs: Copacabana New Year draws millions to the beach.

sections.title: 24. FAQs About Festivals in Rio de Janeiro
paragraphs:

South Zone or downtown.

sections.title: 25. Related Festivals in Nearby Regions
paragraphs: Combine with São Paulo and Espírito Santo festivals.

sections.title: 26. Practical Planning Tips
paragraphs: Book early for carnival and Réveillon.

sections.title: 27. Festival Updates & Annual Changes
paragraphs: Check official city and event calendars.

sections.title: 28. Sources & Cultural References
paragraphs: Rio tourism portals and carnival organizations.

sections.title: 30. Final Summary: Festival Identity of Rio de Janeiro
paragraphs: Rio’s festivals are the global face of Brazilian celebration, blending samba, music, and beachfront spectacle.
